summary: Leiomyosarcoma (LMS) is a rare malignant smooth muscle tumor that can originate in various organs containing smooth muscle, most commonly the uterus and abdomen. It is a type of soft-tissue sarcoma and is more frequently diagnosed in adults. LMSs are generally resistant to chemotherapy and radiation, with surgical removal at an early stage being the most effective treatment.
causes: Genomic instability due to complex karyotypes
